message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

I want to organize all of the issues I have in linear. I am in the process of migrating to linear and i want to update the current issues I have imported from github to utilize all of linears features.

content.text:
Hello, Ojash. Ready to write some awesome code!

I'll help you organize your Linear issues that were imported from GitHub. Let me first check what issues you currently have in Linear to understand the current state.

**Want to learn more?**

* Check out our [docs](https://linear.app/docs) to dive into specific features
* Learn about new features in weekly[ changelogs](https://linear.app/changelog)
* Read the [Linear Method](https://linear.app/linear-method), our approach to software building
* Join our Linear Customer Slack at this [link](http://linear.app/join-slack)

**ProTip: How to trial Linear on your team**

* Use our [in-app importer](https://linear.app/settings/import-export) to add issues from Jira, Asana, Shortcut or GitHub
* Trial it on your team. Pick a project or sprint, invite a few coworkers, add key integrations like Slack and GitHub to experience the full workflow.

* Share projects with multiple teams.
* Set a target date and milestones.
* View progress and estimate completion timeframe with graphs.
* Add overviews, documents and other resources to plan together.
* Share project updates with your team to keep everyone in the loop.

![CleanShot 2024-02-29 at 17.42.09.png](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/dd3e319f-a2dc-4dad-81fe-925eb4b71bd0/a74b9535-5e1d-4dca-b22d-8ba4895dd272)

Learn more about Projects in the [Linear Guide →](https://linear.app/docs/projects)","priority":{"value":4,"name":"Low"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-7/use-projects-to-organize-work-for-features-or-releases","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-7-use-projects-to-organize-work-for-features-or-releases","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:57:58.284Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"52ff85eb-41a3-4284-9a7c-9bc586dfdc4a","identifier":"PKM-6","title":"Use Cycles to focus work over n–weeks","description":"Cycles are a practice to keep up your team's momentum. They're similar to agile flavored sprints but help focus your work without tying it to a release date or feature.

* Customize cycles to last between 1-8 weeks.
* Add issues manually or automatically move issues marked *Todo* to your current cycle.
* Follow progress over time with cycle graphs.
* Any uncompleted issues roll to the next cycle automatically.

![CleanShot 2023-07-10 at 16.22.23.png](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/29272f4b-ee87-487f-9191-2f4f2fcc14a7/ad0f609e-d9d4-45f0-870c-a0b1c1f305ab)

> *✨**ProTip:** Quickly run meetings with the cycles sidebar. Filter issues by assignee and then ask each member to share updates and blockers. At Linear, we run 2-week cycles and follow this format at the beginning of each cycle.*

Read more about cycles in the [Linear Guide →](https://linear.app/docs/use-cycles)","priority":{"value":4,"name":"Low"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-6/use-cycles-to-focus-work-over-n-weeks","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-6-use-cycles-to-focus-work-over-nweeks","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:57:48.076Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"1422988e-c113-475a-80aa-43c5b0f9cd9e","identifier":"PKM-5","title":"Customize settings","description":"Go to [settings](https://linear.app/settings) to enable features such as initiatives, explore features and add integrations. Use `G` then `S` to get there.

Visit individual [team settings](https://linear.app/settings/teams/) to customize features on a team level.

* Configure automated issue workflows for issues linked to PRs
* Add or edit *workflow statuses*, and *labels*
* Add team Slack notifications
* Create reusable *templates*. Use the keyboard shortcut `Alt` `C` to quickly create new issues from templates
* Set your *estimate* scale and enable *cycles*
* Configure time-saving features such as *Auto-close* and *Auto-archive*

![image.png](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/9fc1632b-893e-422c-939f-0cdc9d009b37/image.png)","priority":{"value":3,"name":"Medium"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-5/customize-settings","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-5-customize-settings","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:57:22.467Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"c9f8fa07-d2af-42b8-a1f6-c5a2cab04c39","identifier":"PKM-4","title":"Connect GitHub or GitLab","description":"Connect your account to link issues to pull/merge requests and automate your workflow:

* Link Linear issues to pull requests.
* Automatically update an issue's status when PRs are created or merged.
* Connect one or multiple repos.

[Connect GitHub or GitLab →](https://linear.app/settings/integrations/github)

## Setup tips

#### How to link a Linear issue to a PR

* **Branch name** (e.g. "LIN-123" or "username/LIN-123"). To quickly copy branch name for an issue to your clipboard, press `Cmd/Ctrl` `Shift` `.`
* **Pull request title** (e.g. "GitHub Workflow LIN-123")
* **Pull request description** (e.g. *Fixes LIN-123, Resolves LIN-123*) – it will not work if entered in commits or comments.

#### When you link a Linear issue to a PR, Linear will:

* Create a link to the PR in the Linear issue.
* Comment on the PR with a link back to the Linear issue.
* Once PR has been opened, Linear will change the status of the issue to "In Progress".
* Once PR has been merged, Linear will change the status of the issue as "Done".

#### Suggested Workflow

1. Select or create the issue you want to work on next.
2. Open the command menu (`Cmd` `K` on Mac, or `Ctrl` `K` on Windows) and select **Copy git branch name,** or use the shortcut `Cmd/Ctrl` `Shift` `.`
3. This will copy the git branch name to your clipboard (e.g. `username/LIN-123-github-workflow`
4. Paste the branch name to your git checkout command to create a new branch: `git checkout -b username/LIN-123-github-workflow`
5. Make your changes and push the branch to GitHub and open a pull request
6. Once the pull request is open, Linear will comment on the PR and change the issue state to **In Progress***.* 
7. Once the PR merged, Linear will change the status to Done.

Read full integration instructions for [GitHub](https://linear.app/docs/github) and [GitLab →](https://linear.app/docs/gitlab)","priority":{"value":3,"name":"Medium"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-4/connect-github-or-gitlab","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-4-connect-github-or-gitlab","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:57:10.007Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"e7a6bbc3-9077-4bdc-9ea3-7d2232ac8bda","identifier":"PKM-3","title":"Connect to Slack","description":"If your team uses Slack, enable this integration to keep your workflow and communication in sync. 

* See issue updates in a dedicated channel.
* Use the `/linear` command to create new issues from Slack messages.
* Sync comments between Slack and Linear.
* Set up personal Slack notifications.
* Import custom emoji 🥳 to your Linear workspace.

[Connect Slack →](https://linear.app/settings/integrations/slack)","priority":{"value":3,"name":"Medium"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-3/connect-to-slack","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-3-connect-to-slack","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:56:54.416Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"f41da1c4-697d-4936-af43-c019529c1770","identifier":"PKM-2","title":"3 ways to navigate Linear: Command menu, keyboard or mouse","description":"`Cmd/Ctrl` `K` **is our most powerful feature.** 

Use it to search for or take any action in the app.

[cf798178-b3bc-4ae1-b24f-577d4871ae5d](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/f477604b-f0d2-4ade-8a7a-571830a3b5de/cf798178-b3bc-4ae1-b24f-577d4871ae5d)

If you prefer to use a mouse, right click over any issue for **contextual menus**. They're a great way to learn the keyboard shortcuts, too.

![CleanShot 2023-07-10 at 16.03.57.png](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/11668d24-67e7-431d-9c7d-4bb5f409cae8/650d277b-cc1e-498b-aabd-8d04e8f57680)

If you prefer **keyboard shortcuts**, type `?` to view our full list.","priority":{"value":3,"name":"Medium"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-2/3-ways-to-navigate-linear-command-menu-keyboard-or-mouse","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-2-3-ways-to-navigate-linear-command-menu-keyboard-or-mouse","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:56:48.125Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"f373e6a1-c260-4ef1-93b5-56ae420c0638","identifier":"PKM-1","title":"Welcome to Linear 👋","description":"Hi there. Complete these issues to learn how to use Linear and discover ✨**ProTips.** When you're done, delete them or move them to another team for others to view.

### **To start, type** `C` to **create your first issue.**

Create issues from any view using `C` or by clicking the `New issue` button.

 

[1189b618-97f2-4e2c-ae25-4f25467679e7](https://uploads.linear.app/fe63b3e2-bf87-46c0-8784-cd7d639287c8/532d146d-bcd6-4602-bf1f-83f674b70fff/1189b618-97f2-4e2c-ae25-4f25467679e7)

Our issue editor and comments support Markdown. You can also: 

* @mention a teammate
* Drag & drop images or video (Loom & YouTube embed automatically)
* Use emoji ✅
* Type `/` to bring up more formatting options","priority":{"value":2,"name":"High"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-1/welcome-to-linear","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-1-welcome-to-linear","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:55:53.311Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"8439af1f-12f6-41a0-806a-fd40994884c9","identifier":"PKM-64","title":"[Feature] Railway Redis Integration - Low Priority","description":"## Problem Statement

The PKM assistant currently uses Redis for caching but requires manual configuration for deployment environments. When deploying to Railway, users need to manually configure Redis connection strings and ensure proper SSL/TLS setup. This creates friction in the deployment process and potential for configuration errors.

## Proposed Solution

Implement automatic Railway environment detection and configuration for Redis integration. The application should detect when running on Railway and automatically configure Redis connections using Railway's provided environment variables.

### Implementation Details

1. **Auto-detection**: Check for `RAILWAY_ENVIRONMENT` variable
2. **Configuration**: Use Railway's `REDIS_URL` when available
3. **Fallback**: Support local Redis and manual configuration
4. **Documentation**: Add Railway deployment guide

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Application automatically detects Railway environment
- [ ] Redis connection uses Railway's `REDIS_URL` without manual configuration
- [ ] Local development continues to work with local Redis
- [ ] Manual Redis URL override remains available via environment variables
- [ ] Zero-config deployment: `railway up` results in working application
- [ ] Documentation includes Railway deployment instructions
- [ ] Existing Redis functionality (chat caching) works on Railway

## Technical Considerations

* Modify `apps/backend/src/shared/infrastructure/cache.py` for Railway detection
* Update Redis connection initialization to handle Railway URL format
* Ensure SSL/TLS connections work properly with Railway Redis
* Test connection pooling with Railway's Redis limits
* Consider adding Railway-specific health checks in future iteration

## Estimated Complexity

**Small to Medium** - Mostly configuration changes with minimal code modifications

## Priority

**Low** - Nice to have for Railway users, but not critical for core functionality

## Potential Risks/Blockers

* Railway URL format differences might require parsing adjustments
* SSL/TLS certificate validation might need specific handling
* Connection pooling defaults may need tuning for Railway's limits
* Need Railway account for testing deployment

## Related Issues or Dependencies

* Depends on existing Redis caching implementation
* May benefit from future monitoring/observability features
* Could extend to PostgreSQL Railway integration later

## Future Enhancements (out of scope for v1)

* Railway-specific monitoring i...","url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-64/feature-railway-redis-integration-low-priority","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-64-feature-railway-redis-integration-low-priority","createdAt":"2025-06-05T19:25:50.000Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:48:17.926Z","status":"Backlog","labels":["Migrated","enhancement"],"attachments":[{"id":"a0fcfad2-4d76-40c3-9a39-9ce7f9da28a7","title":"#64 [Feature] Railway Redis Integration - Low Priority","url":"https://github.com/oneopane/pkm-assistant/issues/64"}],"createdBy":"Ojash Neopane","createdById":"b916fa90-bb69-48ef-8daa-a47cbaca0560","team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"}]

* Type `/` to bring up more formatting options","priority":{"value":2,"name":"High"},"url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-1/welcome-to-linear","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-1-welcome-to-linear","createdAt":"2025-06-25T18:40:14.751Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:55:53.311Z","status":"Done","labels":[],"attachments":[],"team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"},{"id":"8439af1f-12f6-41a0-806a-fd40994884c9","identifier":"PKM-64","title":"[Feature] Railway Redis Integration - Low Priority","description":"## Problem Statement

The PKM assistant currently uses Redis for caching but requires manual configuration for deployment environments. When deploying to Railway, users need to manually configure Redis connection strings and ensure proper SSL/TLS setup. This creates friction in the deployment process and potential for configuration errors.

## Proposed Solution

Implement automatic Railway environment detection and configuration for Redis integration. The application should detect when running on Railway and automatically configure Redis connections using Railway's provided environment variables.

### Implementation Details

1. **Auto-detection**: Check for `RAILWAY_ENVIRONMENT` variable
2. **Configuration**: Use Railway's `REDIS_URL` when available
3. **Fallback**: Support local Redis and manual configuration
4. **Documentation**: Add Railway deployment guide

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Application automatically detects Railway environment
- [ ] Redis connection uses Railway's `REDIS_URL` without manual configuration
- [ ] Local development continues to work with local Redis
- [ ] Manual Redis URL override remains available via environment variables
- [ ] Zero-config deployment: `railway up` results in working application
- [ ] Documentation includes Railway deployment instructions
- [ ] Existing Redis functionality (chat caching) works on Railway

## Technical Considerations

* Modify `apps/backend/src/shared/infrastructure/cache.py` for Railway detection
* Update Redis connection initialization to handle Railway URL format
* Ensure SSL/TLS connections work properly with Railway Redis
* Test connection pooling with Railway's Redis limits
* Consider adding Railway-specific health checks in future iteration

## Estimated Complexity

**Small to Medium** - Mostly configuration changes with minimal code modifications

## Priority

**Low** - Nice to have for Railway users, but not critical for core functionality

## Potential Risks/Blockers

* Railway URL format differences might require parsing adjustments
* SSL/TLS certificate validation might need specific handling
* Connection pooling defaults may need tuning for Railway's limits
* Need Railway account for testing deployment

## Related Issues or Dependencies

* Depends on existing Redis caching implementation
* May benefit from future monitoring/observability features
* Could extend to PostgreSQL Railway integration later

## Future Enhancements (out of scope for v1)

* Railway-specific monitoring i...","url":"https://linear.app/pkm-assistant/issue/PKM-64/feature-railway-redis-integration-low-priority","gitBranchName":"oneopane/pkm-64-feature-railway-redis-integration-low-priority","createdAt":"2025-06-05T19:25:50.000Z","updatedAt":"2025-06-25T18:48:17.926Z","status":"Backlog","labels":["Migrated","enhancement"],"attachments":[{"id":"a0fcfad2-4d76-40c3-9a39-9ce7f9da28a7","title":"#64 [Feature] Railway Redis Integration - Low Priority","url":"https://github.com/oneopane/pkm-assistant/issues/64"}],"createdBy":"Ojash Neopane","createdById":"b916fa90-bb69-48ef-8daa-a47cbaca0560","team":"Pkm-assistant","teamId":"3b1620c6-50fc-471f-a9c5-41887a1c8f75"}]

input.description: Fetch Linear issues and extract titles
input.prompt: Use the Linear API to fetch all issues (you may need to paginate if there are many) and then extract just the issue identifiers and titles. Start by fetching issues with a limit of 100, then extract the titles using grep or similar tools. Present the results as a clean numbered list showing the issue identifier (like PKM-XX) and title.
